page.title: 03Roads and Transport
page.content: In the centre the hamlet of Broadford Bridge lies around the junction of two lanes. One winds from West Chiltington across to Coneyhurst; the other is the secondary road B.2133, which was known as 'the King's Highway' from the first mention of roads in the l7th C. This bears all the signs of a medieval road with several old farms set well back. In the southeast corner the B.2139 from Storrington runs straight almost due north to Coolham, where it crosses the A.272, a former turnpike road. The B.2139, a busy commuter traffic route to Horsham, Crawley, and Hayward's Heath, has one infrequent bus service. There are many footpaths in the area, some difficult to negotiate even in fine weather. Bridlepaths are being increasingly used by horse-riders, young and old, as more families keep horses and riding stables proliferate.
